meanings.definition: A type of shoe with a thick wooden sole.
meanings.sent1: She wore comfortable clogs to work every day.
meanings.sent2: The farmer's clogs were perfect for working in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The clogs danced around the room when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: His clogs echoed loudly on the wooden floors.
meanings.sent5: The clogs left a trail of mud wherever she walked.

meanings.sent1: The fallen tree clogs the path through the forest.
meanings.sent2: Leaves and debris clog the drain during heavy rain.
meanings.sent3: His constant excuses clog up the conversation.
meanings.sent4: Traffic clogs the streets during rush hour.
meanings.sent5: The overflowing sink clogs easily with food scraps.

meanings.definition: A type of shoe with a thick wooden sole.
meanings.sent1: The traditional Dutch clogs are made of wood.
meanings.sent2: She bought a pair of colorful clogs for her vacation.
meanings.sent3: The clogs clattered noisily down the stairs.
meanings.sent4: His clogs left imprints in the soft soil.
meanings.sent5: The clogs were surprisingly light despite their appearance.

meanings.sent1: Ice can clog the narrow river in winter.
meanings.sent2: The fallen leaves clog the gutter every autumn.
meanings.sent3: His forgetfulness tends to clog up the process.
meanings.sent4: Emotions can clog our ability to think clearly.
meanings.sent5: The dust clogs the air filter, causing the engine to overheat.
